title: Hydraulic sludge robot deployed to cut stones, move through debris in Telangana SLBC tunnel on 19th day of rescue work
content: SCCL procured timber from its store and the third cognac was constructed yesterday towards the end of the tunnel to ensure safety against any blocks falling from the top, sources said

title: Five students of school at Kalamassery in Kerala show symptoms of viral meningitis
content: Condition of children remains stable. Samples sent to National Institute of Virology, Alappuzha, for testing

title: Markets turn flat after rallying in early trade amid volatile trends
content: The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 289.83 points or 0.39% to 74,392.15 in the morning trade. On the similar lines, the Nifty went up 79.5 points or 0.35% to 22,577.40

title: Remand prisoner Borugadda Anil Kumar surrenders before Rajahmundry Central Prison day after expiry of interim bail
content: Mr. Anil Kumar did not surrender before the prison authorities on March 11 as directed by the High Court of Andhra Pradesh; The Prison Superintendent writes to the court for further action for failing to adhere to the latter’s  order.

title: BEE leads Centre’s survey on energy-efficient cooling solutions
content: Replacing outdated ACs with 5-star-rated models could improve efficiency by up to 60% and reduce overall power consumption, said BEE media advisor (South)

title: People living near river drains are at elevated risk of developing cancer: ICMR
content: Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare, Prataprao Jadhav stated this in a written reply in the Rajya Sabha

title: JD(S) MLC Bhoje Gowda turns Legislative Council of Karnataka into concert hall
content: When members were discussing the problems faced by adolescents, with special reference to female adolescents, the MLC broke into a Kannada song by Gururaj Hoskote describing the pain of a mother while marrying off her daughter

title: Karnataka Budget session: Amended APMC Bill seeks to include e-commerce platforms
content: The term “warehouse service provider” has been inserted to bring the e-commerce platform under the ambit of APMC to collect cess

title: Delhi Police continues crackdown on ‘illegal’ Bangladeshi immigrants
content: Delhi Police had earlier arrested three “illegal” Bangladeshi immigrants from the outer district’s Peeragarhi area

title: Vice Chancellors, academicians decry attempt to prevent JU academic from entering campus
content: Professor Om Prakash Mishra, one of the senior most professors of the State run university, was prevented by a section of protesting students from entering the campus on March 10

title: U.S. Vice-President Vance likely to travel to India later this month: Report
content: J.D. Vance and Second Lady Usha Vance to visit India, marking Usha’s first trip to her ancestral country

title: File counter in drone case against Revanth Reddy: HC asks public prosecutor
content: The case was registered against Mr. Revanth Reddy when he was Malkajgiri MP and was accused of flying a drone over a farm house reportedly belonging to BRS working president and MLA K.T. Rama Rao

title: Three-time Congress MLA Jagga Reddy to set the silver screen ablaze
content: Mr. Reddy clarified that he is not going away from politics and has accepted the film that is woven around his personality just for fun

title: Jio ties up with Elon Musk’s SpaceX to offer Starlink’s broadband internet in India
content: This agreement, which is subject to SpaceX receiving its own authorizations to sell Starlink in India, would enable Jio and SpaceX to explore how Starlink can extend Jio’s offerings and how Jio can complement SpaceX’s direct offerings to consumers and businesses

title: Mysore man takes mother on pan-India pilgrimage on scooter; reaches Visakhapatnam
content: D. Krishna Kumar and his mother has covered 92,822 km as part of their pilgrimage titled ‘Matru Seva Sankalpa Yatra’ on a 2001 model Bajaj Chetak scooter

title: Two lakh tonnes of waste will be cleared from Vizag dumping yard, says SACL Chairman
content: Swachch Andhra programmes are being organised every third Saturday of the month in all Urban Local Bodies with different themes, says Pattabhi Ram

title: Will continue protests till internship stipend is increased, say NTR college veterinary students
content: BVSc students at NTR College of Veterinary Science protest for internship stipend hike, seeking support from government officials

title: GBA provision to appoint ward committee members draws citizens’ ire
content: Experts say Greater Bengaluru Authority’s power should not extend to ward committees as this could restrict the participation of eligible citizens

title: Chief Minister tells SRM-University A.P. to lead the start-up ecosystem
content: Naidu calls upon the institution to develop a strong workforce of designers, coders and experts with skills in algorithms and hardware, which are vital for building a progressive state

title: ECI invites suggestions from political parties for resolving issues
content: Election Commission of India seeks input from political parties to address electoral issues by April 30, 2025

title: Hosts India drawn with Nepal, Sri Lanka in SAFF U19 Championship
content: Golden Jubilee Stadium in Yupia, Arunachal Pradesh to host SAFF U19 men’s tournament from May 9-18, 2025. India defending champions

title: Tamil Nadu government refusing to implement NEP for political reasons: Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar
content: Speaking to reporters outside Parliament, Union Minister of State for Education said that the claims of any differential treatment to Tamil Nadu were false.

title: 283 Indians trapped in illegal jobs in Myanmar rescued, brought back
content: They were forced to work in fraudulent call centres operating in regions along Myanmar-Thailand border and were subsequently made to indulge in cybercrime and other fraudulent activities

title: RSS leader wants India to be called only as ‘Bharat’
content: Dattatreya Hosabale questions if anywhere in the world a country has two names, one in Hindi and the other in English

title: TMC, BJP delegations rally before ECI over discrepancies in West Bengal voter list
content: The TMC delegation said that EPIC numbers are unique and it remains unclear as to “how many duplicate votes have been cast across various elections due to this EPIC number issue”; The BJP leaders called for an extensive review of W.B. voter list

title: God will protect the author of this judgment, says judge after ruling that temple property can be acquired for public purpose
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh holds against CMRL’s attempt to acquire an insurance company’s property in order to spare a temple land

title: Tejashwi, sister Rohini slam Bihar CM over ₹25 crore robbery in Ara
content: On March 10, six armed men pretending to be customers carried out a heist by robbing the jewellery at gunpoint. Police have recovered two out of three bags looted from the showroom apart from arresting two robbers.

title: A comedian and a musician set sparks flying at The Hindu office
content: Their conversation ranged from how to deal with criticism, separating art from artists, questioning hegemonic spaces, to sartorial choices

title: RJD MP submits ‘evidence’ against Bihar’s Finance Department officials to PMO, CAG
content: He alleged abuse of power by Bihar Chief Minister’s Principal Secretary and Finance Department’s Principal Secretary

title: Kochi metro phase-III could extend up to Ayyampuzha, say officials
content: This would help usher in Transit Oriented Development on the stretch, helping decongest the city, they say

title: Even before Katchatheevu was ceded, Sri Lanka had periodically arrested Tamil Nadu fishers
content: While visiting Rameswaram recently, Tamil Nadu Governor R.N. Ravi blamed the 1974 cession of Katchatheevu to Sri Lanka for the continuing arrest of fishermen. However, according to reports from The Hindu Archives, even before the islet was ceded, fishermen were arrested periodically by the Sri Lankan Navy on the charge of poaching

title: Minister lambastes KTR for his TDR comments
content: Minister D. Sridhar Babu criticizes K. T. Rama Rao over TDR allegations, invites Opposition for constructive suggestions

title: Don’t stand in the way of aspirations of students, Dharmendra Pradhan tells Tamil Nadu government
content: Decline in enrolment in Tamil-medium schools shows a clear shift in preference, the Union Education Minister says

title: Justice Ramaswami: The first judge of the Supreme Court to face impeachment proceedings
content: An impeachment motion was moved against him in the Lok Sabha for extravagant spending when he was the Chief Justice of the Punjab and Haryana High Court. When it was put to vote on May 11, 1993, of the 401 members present, 196 backed the motion and 205 abstained. Calls for his resignation continued, but he retired in February 1994

title: Desilting work begins in Mordhana dam canal near Gudiyatham
content: Thick vegetation on the canal bed has prevented steady flow of water. It resulted in breach of the bund, resulting in inundation. The entire desilt and other works will be completed before northeast monsoon, says an official

title: ASHA workers will get enhanced remuneration, says Health Minister Nadda
content: The announcement comes at a time when there has been demand from across the country that ASHA workers, who form the backbone of the government’s outreach programme to reduce infant and maternal mortality, should get better pay

title: How Mysuru zoo is keeping its animals cool in the searing heat
content: A number of initiatives have been introduced to reduce heat stress among the animals and ensure their well-being

title: T.N. Education Minister and Centre spar over State’s stance on NEP
content: Anbil Mahesh Poyyamozhi and Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan clash over National Education Policy on social media.

title: Proposed immigration law seeks to add more teeth to existing rules
content: Stricter penalties for violations such as use of forged travel documents, non-adherence to visa conditions, overstay, and deliberately avoiding registration with the Foreigners Regional Registration Office

title: Highways still blocked in Churachandpur, Kangpokpi as Union Home Ministry team begins talks with Kuki Zo groups
content: Security convoys stopped in Kangpokpi, which remains shut; Churachandpur opens for economic activity, but women protestors only allow entry of vehicles carrying essential commodities

title: Don’t arrest Ranya’s husband without due process of law: Karnataka High Court
content: Jatin Hukkeri states he married Ranya in November last year, and their relationship began to sour within months

title: Kharge questions Nadda over Minister’s absence from RS
content: Why doesn’t he train his Ministers who don’t turn up on time, asks Kharge, a day after Nadda suggested that the Opposition take a refresher course in parliamentary rules

title: ‘Habitual offender’ laws in effect in 14 States and UTs, government tells Lok Sabha
content: Gujarat explicitly opines against repealing it, many others say the law is practically redundant; Supreme Court had urged States to reconsider the need for it altogether

title: Finance Minister announces ₹500-crore corpus for strife-torn Manipur
content: Asserting that overall law and order situation has improved in the State, except for some sporadic incidents, Nirmala Sitharaman says all financial support will be provided to Manipur

title: States with successful family planning record will be ‘penalised’ in delimitation exercise: Congress
content: Citing an analysis of 2001, 2011 Census data, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh says T.N., Kerala, undivided Andhra Pradesh set to lose 8 LS seats each due to delimitation, while U.P. to gain 11 seats, and Bihar 10

title: Kerala continues to grapple with flip side of migration
content: In just one year, three Keralites were killed in foreign territory by armies while undertaking a risky migration.  Kerala, which has a long history of organised migration, is now grappling with the challenges of irregular migration

title: PVR INOX case: HC stays Bengaluru consumer commission’s order
content: The commission had imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on PVR INOX multiplex for playing commercial advertisements for about 25 minutes and delaying the screening of a movie last year.

title: Tamil Nadu School Education Department dismisses 23 teachers, staff facing charges under POCSO Act
content: According to sources in the department, the move was taken after a final investigation was conducted by the department regarding 46 cases against teachers.

title: Former CJI Ranjan Gogoi criticises Bill on simultaneous elections
content: At a meeting of Parliament’s Joint Committee reviewing the Bill, Justice Gogoi said Election Commission cannot be given unregulated powers to decide the tenure of a State Assembly

title: Top global intelligence czars to converge in India this weekend to hold crucial deliberations
content: India’s National Security Advisor Ajit Doval will chair the India-hosted conclave on March 16, which is expected to deliberate on ways to enhance intelligence sharing to combat terrorism and various transnational crimes

title: Vasavan seeks resumption of passenger ship service between Beypore and Lakshadweep
content: Ports Minister V.N. Vasavan urges Ministry of Shipping to restart passenger ship service between Lakshadweep and Beypore port

title: Farmers demand release of water from KRS, Kabini reservoirs to fill up waterbodies
content: They said that several standing crops, fruits and vegetables were drying up under the scorching summer sun

title: Land ownership granted to families relocated due to landslide threat in Thrissur’s Akamala
content: Land documents and tax payment receipts handed over to beneficiaries by District Collector Arjun Pandian

title: Mauritius is family, it’s bridge between India and Global South: PM Modi tells diaspora
content: On March 12, 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the island nation's national day celebrations as the chief guest.

title: Koodalmanikyam temple row: staffer says he is not interested in ‘Kazhakam’ duties any more
content: Balu says he will send a letter to the Devaswom authorities. Representatives of priests say appointment violated devaswom rules

title: Source: Bills, DE J. Bosa agree on 1-year, $12.6M
content: The Bills and five-time Pro Bowl DE Joey Bosa reached agreement on a one-year deal worth $12.6 million, a source told ESPN.

title: Sources: Ravens adding Hopkins on 1-year deal
content: DeAndre Hopkins has reached a one-year, $5 million deal that could get up to as much as $6 million with the Baltimore Ravens, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Tuesday.

title: Cavs win 15th straight for 2nd time this season
content: The NBA-leading Cavaliers rallied from 18 down in the third quarter to beat the Nets and match the longest winning streak in franchise history.

title: Tiger has surgery for ruptured Achilles tendon
content: Tiger Woods, who hasn't competed in a PGA Tour event this season, said he had surgery to repair a ruptured left Achilles tendon and expects to make a full recovery.

title: Ex-NBA player, entrepreneur Bridgeman dies at 71
content: Junior Bridgeman, a former NBA sixth man who became a billionaire philanthropist and Bucks minority owner, died at the age of 71.

title: Haliburton's 'impossible' 4-point play lifts Pacers
content: Tyrese Haliburton converted a four-point play to put the Pacers up one in the final seconds of an eventual victory Tuesday over the Bucks.

title: Gonzaga wins WCC tourney title, 20th under Few
content: Gonzaga avenged two regular-season losses to Saint Mary's, defeating the 19th-ranked Gaels 58-51 in the West Coast Conference Tournament championship on Tuesday night, the 22nd league tourney title for the Bulldogs, including 20 under coach Mark Few.

title: Floyd signs with Falcons after exit from 49ers
content: The Falcons signed defensive end Leonard Floyd, who was released by the San Francisco 49ers on Tuesday.

title: Men's Bracketology: Gonzaga rises with big day for bubble teams on tap
content: The Zags improved their seeding in our projected field of 68 after clinching the WCC tournament title.

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: Free agency has kicked off with the legal negotiation window and there has already been plenty of action.

title: What happens in Vegas: Oregon State punches ticket, UNLV upset to shake up women's Bracketology
content: Champ Week claimed another conference tournament 1-seed when UNLV was upset. But Oregon State's unlikely path to March Madness won the day.

title: NHL playoff watch: Who will make the Eastern Conference finals?
content: The Hurricanes and Lightning both have good shots, and they face off Tuesday on ESPN+. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: 'He's got it': An oral history of the NBA's COVID-19 shutdown -- and how it changed sports forever
content: On the fifth anniversary of the night the NBA shut down, ESPN reveals how it happened, down to the minute -- told by the players, executives, politicians, doctors and journalists who were there.

title: A 40-year-old throwing 94.5 mph? A .696 batting average!? Spring training numbers we do (and don't) believe in
content: It's hard to know which stats to trust this time of year. So we dig in to separate what's real from the March mirages.

title: Olney: Yankees must replace Gerrit Cole -- but they'll probably have to wait
content: Fans might want a big splash after New York lost its ace, but the right fit emerging could be months away.

title: How PSG's midfield and the new Champions League format ousted Liverpool
content: Liverpool's tense exit from the Champions League was a game to forget for Darwin Núñez. Meanwhile, PSG's Ousmane Dembélé and Gianluigi Donnarumma silenced their critics en route to the quarterfinals.

title: Man United's new stadium will be big, but it won't be world's biggest football ground
content: Manchester United's proposed new 100,000-seat home will be one of the world's largest soccer stadiums, but it won't be the biggest.

title: The ACC is on track for its fewest men's NCAA tournament bids in 25 years -- what's next?
content: The storied college basketball conference is in flux, but it's banking on an injection of money and young wave of coaches to carry it into this new era.

title: Juan Soto first OF pick in last mock before Opening Day
content: Check out the results of our first fantasy baseball head-to-head points mock draft of 2025, featuring round-by-round picks and a snapshot of the rosters of all 10 teams.

title: PSG oust Liverpool in shootout to reach UCL last 8
content: Paris Saint-Germain beat Liverpool 4-1 in a penalty shootout to advance to the Champions League quarterfinals after winning a rip-roaring last-16 second-leg match at Anfield 1-0 on Tuesday.

title: Slot: Loss to PSG 'best game' I've been part of
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot described the second leg of his team's Champions League tie with Paris Saint-Germain as the "best game of football" he has been involved in.

title: Man Utd CEO: New stadium poses 'risk' to team
content: Manchester United CEO Omar Berrada has admitted the club "risk" falling further behind their rivals while they invest in their new stadium.

title: Bayern coach Kompany says Kane 'better with age'
content: Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane earned praise from coach Vincent Kompany on Tuesday after scoring one goal and setting up another in a 2-0 victory at Bayer Leverkusen that saw them book their Champions League quarter-final spot.

title: Barça 'determined' to win for team doctor who died
content: Barcelona forward Raphinha said the passing of team doctor Carles Miñarro made the players even more intent on putting on a show against Benfica in the Champions League on Tuesday.

title: Son of ex-Brazil star Marcelo gets Spain U17 call
content: Enzo Alves, son of former Real Madrid and Brazil left back Marcelo, was called up for Spain's under-17 national team on Tuesday.

title: Labor union says FIFA blocked Azteca inspection
content: An international federation of labor unions said on Tuesday that FIFA denied it access to the Azteca Stadium to inspect conditions of construction workers doing renovations ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: PSV to compensate fans at Arsenal tie after 7-1
content: PSV have announced that they will compensate their fans attending the second leg of their round of 16 Champions League tie at Arsenal on Wednesday.

title: NWSL ambition rankings: Who is No. 1 in 2025 when it comes to raising the game?
content: With the 2025 NWSL season kicking off this weekend, it's time to unveil our second annual ambition rankings. Which teams are leading the way and who is just trying to keep up?

title: Waiver wire pickups: Look to Naji Marshall, Stephon Castle
content: The waiver wire always has players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add this week.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Arsenal, Man Utd eye Raphinha
content: Raphinha's fine form for Barcelona has Liverpool, Arsenal and Manchester United all interested. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Ferrari's debut winners: Can Lewis Hamilton join list of legends?
content: Some of the biggest names in F1 history have won in their debuts with Ferrari, a feat Lewis Hamilton will look to replicate on Sunday in Australia.

title: 'India imposes 150% tariff on American alcohol': White House
content: The White House criticized tariffs imposed on US products by India and Canada, highlighting significant tariffs on American alcohol and agricultural goods by India. President Trump advocates for fair trade, hinting at potential tariff increases to counteract what he views as unfair international trade practices.

title: Dalit groom on horse assaulted, hit with pistol butt in UP, 3 booked
content: A case has been filed against three men for assaulting a Dalit groom and threatening to kill him if he did not dismount his horse during his wedding procession in Agra. The accused also hurled casteist slurs, broke portraits of Dr BR Ambedkar and Gautam Buddha, and attacked the groom's grandfather.

title: 'God will forgive': Madras HC allows acquisition of two temple lands
content: Madras High Court ruled that temple land could be acquired for the Chennai Metro Rail project if it benefits devotees, rejecting a PIL against the acquisition. The court also criticized CMRL’s plan to take over United India Insurance's land, noting it violated natural justice principles since the company was not properly informed.

title: Trump's 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports take effect: Impact on India
content: Trump's 25% tariff on steel and aluminum imports, effective Wednesday, aims to boost US factory jobs despite market concerns. Exemptions are removed, and aluminum tariffs increased to 10%. These measures may challenge Indian steel manufacturers and prompt international trade disputes, while US domestic steel producers may benefit from higher prices and market access.

title: Fb's ex-COO 'lied' about boarding flight that crash-landed, claims ex-employee
content: Sheryl Sandberg is accused by Sarah Wynn-Williams of fabricating a story about almost boarding Asiana Airlines Flight 214, which crash-landed in 2013. Wynn-Williams claims Sandberg's assertion was untrue, supported by skeptical comments from other former colleagues.

title: 'Rohit wants one more crack at ODI World Cup'
content: The former Ausralia captain believes Rohit Sharma has decided not to retire from ODIs following India's triumph in the ICC Champions Trophy because he has his sights set on the next ODI World Cup in 2027. Putting all speculation around his retirement to bed, Rohit said he is not going to retire and sent a clear message that he firmly believes he can still deliver at the top level, while continuing to lead the team.

title: 'Eating halal not written in Hindu religion': Rane proposes 'Malhar certification'
content: Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane supports Malhar certification as an alternative to halal mutton for Hindus, claiming it aligns with Hindu practices. His comments received criticism from Congress MLA Nana Patole, who called for the Chief Minister to take action. BJP MLA Sanjay Upadhyay backed Rane, citing health concerns about halal practices. The initiative aims to promote Hindu-owned mutton shops.

title: Apple loses $174bn in one day as Microsoft, Google lost $750bn on Manic Monday
content: In a major market downturn, America's top seven tech companies, including Apple, Microsoft, Tesla, and Nvidia, lost over $750 billion in market value due to concerns over new tariffs. Apple alone dropped $174 billion, while Tesla faced a 15% drop. Semiconductor stocks also faced significant losses amidst the market turmoil.

title: What’s the most-seized check-in bag item at Bengaluru airport?
content: Air travellers are advised to carry power banks only in their hand luggage due to the risk of fire from lithium ion batteries. Kempegowda International Airport seized over 1,412 kg of power banks, along with other items like lighters and e-cigarettes, from checked baggage between January last year and February this year.

title: Indian-origin worker gets over 10 year imprisonment for assaulting teen in Singapore
content: Ranjeet Prasad, an Indian origin former PA youth worker in Singapore, has been convicted of sexually assaulting a 16-year-old boy in 2007, receiving a 10-year and six-month prison sentence. He exploited the teenager's aspirations and abused his authority, with the court noting his lack of remorse.

title: Pakistan train hijack: Jaffar Express a hot target for BLA for years now
content: In recent years, the Jaffar Express has faced multiple attacks by Baloch rebels and TTP, causing numerous casualties. These attacks highlight the ongoing insurgency in Balochistan and the rising use of suicide bombings by BLA, particularly targeting Chinese nationals and Pakistani forces. The increased frequency and intensity of these attacks pose significant challenges for the Pakistani government.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO on return-to-office policy: I respect people who …
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon defended the bank's return-to-office policy requiring employees to work in-person five days a week, citing company and client needs over individual preferences. The mandate has attracted criticism, particularly from the tech workforce, but Dimon remains firm, suggesting those dissatisfied can leave, despite potential talent retention challenges.

title: Removing this food from diet can help reduce almost 4 kilos, say scientists
content: The study published in the Obesity Science and Practice journal found that ultra-processed foods (UPFs) significantly contribute to weight gain. By reducing UPFs in their diet, participants consumed 600 fewer daily calories and lost an average of 3.5 kg over eight weeks. Transitioning to healthier options involves gradual swaps like replacing sugary drinks and cooking homemade meals.

title: Watch: Chahal trolls Rizwan with iconic one-liner
content: Yuzvendra Chahal, known for his humour and wicket-taking skills, joins Punjab Kings for IPL 2025. Despite a strong IPL 2024 season with 18 wickets, he was not retained by Rajasthan Royals. Now with PBKS, Chahal aims for a national team comeback, starting with impressive domestic performances in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

title: Pak train hijack: BLA issues 48-hour ultimatum, threatens to execute more hostages
content: In Pakistan's Balochistan province, armed militants hijacked a passenger train, killing three people and taking over 450 hostages. Security forces responded swiftly, rescuing more than 150 passengers and killing 27 militants. The Baloch Liberation Army claimed responsibility for the attack, which unfolded as militants targeted the train by blowing up the railway track.

title: 'Trump is always right': US President dismisses recession fears
content: US President Trump dismissed recession fears, asserting confidence in economic growth despite recent market turbulence. He emphasized his approach will yield significant results. His comments followed Tesla's share price decline, amidst Wall Street's volatile performance due to uncertainties in tariff policies. Analysts caution that trade uncertainties may continue to impact markets.

title: 'Do whatever the hell you want': Iran President rejects Trump's proposal
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian refuses to negotiate a nuclear deal with the US amidst threats from President Donald Trump. Trump's maximum pressure campaign and letter to Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei expressing his willingness to negotiate a deal have been met with rejection from Iranian leaders.

title: Cat killed, set on fire for 'bringing misfortune' by crossing UP woman's path
content: A woman and her friends in Moradabad's Bhojpur area are accused of killing a cat deemed to bring bad fortune. The group recorded and shared the incident on social media. They face charges under the Wildlife Protection Act, facing up to three years in prison and a Rs 1 lakh fine. Authorities are seeking her and accomplices.

title: Holi and Holika Dahan: Correct date, muhurat, rituals, and all one needs to know
content: Holi 2025 celebrations will occur on March 13th and 14th, starting with Holika Dahan and followed by Rangwali Holi. Holika Dahan symbolizes the victory of good over evil, with rituals carried out around a bonfire. It's advised to use organic colors and play Holi consensually.

title: Stock market today: Sensex opens over 250 points up; Nifty50 above 22,550
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green on Wednesday. While BSE Sensex was above 74,300, Nifty50 was above 22,550.

title: Violence at Tesla dealerships to be labeled 'domestic terrorism': Trump
content: President Donald Trump has expressed his intent to classify violent protesters at Tesla dealerships as domestic terrorists. Accompanied by Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Trump emphasized his commitment to protecting American companies from such acts, while also purchasing a Tesla Model S to show support for Musk amid massive protests and boycott calls.

title: Viral video: Dhoni, Raina, and Pant set the dance floor on fire
content: A viral video shows MS Dhoni, Suresh Raina, and Rishabh Pant dancing to 'Dama Dam Mast Qalandar' during Pant's sister Sakshi's sangeet ceremony in Mussoorie. The cricketers enjoyed the celebrations, with Dhoni making a rare public appearance. Fans are thrilled by this cheerful off-field moment ahead of the upcoming IPL season.

title: First time this year, Mumbai nears 40°C; IMD issues heatwave warning
content: Mumbai recorded its first near 40-degree temperature as the IMD Santacruz observatory noted a maximum of 39.2 degrees, surpassing last March's highest temperature. A heatwave warning for Mumbai, Thane, and Raigad was issued, predicting hot and humid conditions. Temperatures might dip soon due to the late arrival of the sea breeze, bringing some relief.

title: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina's home seized, family assets frozen
content: A Dhaka court has ordered the seizure of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's residence and other properties owned by her family, and frozen 124 bank accounts linked to them. This action follows an application by the Anti-Corruption Commission. Bangladesh's ministry of foreign affairs has protested false statements by Hasina.

title: Indian embassy in US warns against fraud calls impersonating officials
content: The Indian embassy in the United States has issued a warning about fraud calls from scammers pretending to be from the embassy. These callers claim there are errors in passports or visa forms, demanding money for corrections and threatening deportation or imprisonment. The embassy advises the public to ignore these calls and not to share personal information or transfer money.

title: Air India: Aging aircraft, old ducts and passenger behaviour lead to stink
content: Air India, now under Tata Group, continues to face issues with clogged toilets caused by passengers flushing inappropriate items. Engineers noted the old aircrafts’ ducts are increasingly susceptible to blockages, leading to disrupted flights. Most foreign airlines experience this problem rarely, highlighting different passenger behavior aboard Indian carriers. Crew suggests educating passengers and improving onboard waste management systems.

title: Will throw Muslim MLAs out of assembly after BJP wins Bengal: Suvendu
content: Bengal’s opposition leader, Suvendu Adhikari, has caused controversy by stating the BJP would forcibly remove Muslim MLAs from the assembly upon forming the next government. The Trinamool Congress criticized the statement as hate speech, questioning Adhikari's mental stability following recent political defections.

title: Exclusive: Gautam Gambhir to travel with India 'A' to England
content: Head coach Gautam Gambhir plans to travel with India 'A' team to England before the senior team's tour to monitor the reserve pool and prepare for major tournaments including WTC, T20, and ODI World Cups. Emphasizing separate focus on T20 and ODI formats, Gambhir aims to revive India 'A' tours and develop a solid player pool for future competitions.

title: Buy or Sell: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari from Anand Rathi Shares recommends buying Tube Investments, Godrej Agrovet Ltd, and Astrazeneca Pharma. Each stock has shown signs of positive movement.

title: Ukraine agrees to truce offer by US; America in return to resume aid
content: Ukraine has endorsed a U.S. proposal for a 30-day ceasefire with Russia, with the U.S. agreeing to lift restrictions on military aid and intelligence sharing. Following negotiations in Saudi Arabia, both nations aim to finalize a deal on Ukrainian minerals. President Trump has temporarily halted military aid to Ukraine, emphasizing the pursuit of peace.

title: 'US VP JD Vance and wife Usha to visit India next month'
content: US Vice President JD Vance, along with his wife Usha Vance, will visit India later this month. This marks Vance's second international trip after criticizing European leaders at the Munich Security Conference. Usha Vance, of Indian origin with a strong legal background, brings cultural significance to the visit.

title: Afridi slams PCB, says 'Pakistan cricket is in ICU because ...'
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Shahid Afridi criticises PCB for poor decisions, claiming Pakistan cricket is in 'ICU.' He questions Shadab Khan's recall, citing lack of standout performances. Afridi highlights a lack of continuity and accountability within PCB, and the damaging blame culture that affects players and staff. He urges PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi to focus on one job.

title: Varun Chakravarthy's inspirational journey to Champions Trophy triumph
content: Varun Chakravarthy's transition from a brief acting stint in the Tamil film 'Jeeva' to a key player in India's cricket team is remarkable. Known for his mystery spin, Varun was instrumental in India's 2025 ICC Champions Trophy win, delivering exceptional performances and securing crucial victories.

title: 'Final match. You perform. What Happening?': Meme recreated - Watch
content: India's Champions Trophy 2025 victory inspired a hilarious video with Hardik Pandya, Arshdeep Singh, and Harshit Rana recreating the iconic meme, ‘Final match. You perform. What happening?’ in Dubai. With significant contributions from Rohit Sharma, Axar Patel, KL Rahul, and Shreyas Iyer, India secured a win over New Zealand, adding humor to their celebratory mood.

title: Over 150 Hostages Rescued From Hijacked Train In Pakistan, 27 Rebels Killed
content: Over 150 hostages have been freed after armed rebels hijacked a train carrying over 400 passengers in Pakistan's restive Balochistan region. At least 27 rebels have been killed in a firefight with the forces, suggest reports.

title: Pakistan Train Hijack Live Updates: 155 Hostages Freed, 27 Rebels Killed
content: The Jaffar Express was intercepted by armed attackers in a tunnel in a remote area on its way from Quetta to Peshawar - a route that was made operational after a month-long suspension.

title: Complaint Against Tollywood Veteran Decades After 'Sooryavansham' Actor Death
content: Over two decades after 'Sooryavansham' actor Soundarya's death in a plane crash, serious allegations have emerged against veteran Telugu actor Mohan Babu.

title: "Get In, Patriots": Donald Trump Buys Tesla, Elon Musk Helps Him Pick
content: Donald Trump bought the Tesla in a show of support for Elon Musk's electric vehicle company, which is facing a blowback because of the Tesla CEO's work to advance the President's political agenda.

title: Ukraine Agrees To Ceasefire Proposal, US Says "Ball Now In Russia's Court"
content: Ukraine on Tuesday backed a US proposal for a 30-day general ceasefire with Russia, with the United States in turn agreeing to lift restrictions on military aid and intelligence sharing, a joint statement said.

title: "No Words To Describe": Freed Pak Train Hijack Hostage Recounts Horror
content: Rebels waging a war of independence against the Pakistani state set off explosions on the railway track in a remote area of Balochistan, forcing the train to a halt and taking more than 450 passengers hostage.

title: No Gold Purchase Receipt, Rs 2 Crore At Home: What Led To Ranya Rao's Arrest
content: Ranya Rao was arrested while smuggling gold at the Bengaluru International Airport and is in the custody of the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence.

title: US Veep JD Vance, Wife Usha Vance To Visit India This Month: Report
content: This will be JD Vance's second foreign visit since assuming office and his wife's first time visiting her ancestral country as a second lady.

title: Watch: Last Footage Of Indian Student Who Went Missing In Dominican Republic
content: Sudiksha Konanki, the Indian student who went missing from the Dominican Republic, was last seen walking with friends hours before she mysteriously vanished from a beach on the Caribbean island.

title: 'India Charges 150% Tariff On American Alcohol, Not Helping': White House
content: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt, while lamenting the tariffs imposed by various nations on the United States, referred to the tariffs imposed by India on American alcohol and agricultural products.

title: Union Minister Shares Tamil Nadu's Letter On PM SHRI Schools, Row Intensifies
content: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan shared a letter from the Tamil Nadu school education department that said the southern state was "very keen" to set up PM SHRI Schools, as the Union Minister launched a counter-attack against the DMK.

title: PCB Gets Blunt 'Protocol' Reminder By ICC Over CT Ceremony Row: Report
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) is unlikely to receive any "formal clarification" from the ICC on the perceived snub during the closing ceremony of the Champions Trophy in Dubai.

title: "Won't Negotiate, Do Whatever The Hell You Want": Iran President To Trump
content: President Masoud Pezeshkian said Iran would not negotiate with the U.S. while being threatened, telling President Donald Trump to "do whatever the hell you want", Iranian state media reported on Tuesday.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Canada backs down from 25% electricity surcharge after Trump's retaliation
content: Ontario will suspend a 25 percent electricity surcharge on three American states, Premier Doug Ford said Tuesday, after "productive" talks with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. This came after Donald Trump threatened with retaliatory tariffs of 50 per cent on steel and aluminum which was supposed to be effective from tomorrow.

title: With 13 of 20 most polluted cities, India ranks 5th globally
content: India ranked as the fifth most polluted country worldwide in 2024, with Byrnihat in Meghalaya being the most polluted metropolitan area globally. High pollution levels are linked to rapid industrialisation and unregulated emissions. Despite some improvement, Delhi remains the most polluted capital, and India's cities continue to exceed WHO PM2.5 guidelines.

title: Trump administration crackdown on Education Department, halves workforce
content: The US Education Department is cutting its workforce by nearly 50%, affecting hundreds of employees and closing several regional offices. This move is part of President Trump's proposal to eliminate the department, aiming to decentralize education and return power to states, students, and families.

title: ‘Chhaava’ collection: Vicky Kaushal starrer aims at Rs 600 crore
content: The historical drama ‘Chhaava’ featuring Vicky Kaushal celebrates a 26-day successful box office run, with a total collection of ₹530.95 crore. Despite a slow fourth week, the film aims to reach ₹600 crore, bolstered by its Telugu release. Directed by Laxman Utekar, it surpasses collections of ‘Gadar 2’ and ‘Baahubali 2’, becoming Vicky Kaushal’s highest-grossing film.

title: Watch: Trump buys Tesla Model S from Musk, says he wants no discount
content: As promised, US President Donald Trump Tuesday bought a Tesla car (Model S) from Elon Musk after Musk lined up a few Teslas in front of the White House for the President to choose. Trump even went behind the wheels and Musk showed him the inside of the car. Elon Musk's son X pranced as Donald Trump took questions from the reporters and Elon Musk waited for him.

title: Kharge’s ‘thokenge’ barb stirs a different ‘language row’ in Rajya Sabha
content: A heated exchange occurred in Rajya Sabha over Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge's controversial remark, 'aapko theek se thokenge.' BJP demanded an apology and expungement of the remark. Kharge later apologized, clarifying his comments were directed at government policies, not the Chair.

title: Despite slide, sensex to hit 105,000 points by year-end: Report
content: Morgan Stanley maintains its year-end Sensex target of 105,000 points by December 2025 despite global trade tensions and recent market volatility. Strategists suggest India's earnings growth is improving and highlight the attractiveness of stock valuations post-Covid. However, external risks like US tariff policies and dollar strength remain concerns.

title: Brad Marchand injury update: NHL insider reveals key details
content: NHL insider Chris Johnston provided an important update on Florida Panthers forward Brad Marchand's recovery after his trade from the Boston Bruins. Marchand's return is anticipated closely by fans as his presence could be pivotal for the Panthers' playoff hopes. Marchand's transition to the Panthers remains a point of intrigue given his long tenure with the Bruins.

title: Airtel deal with Musk’s Starlink to bring high-speed net to India
content: Airtel gains a competitive edge by entering a partnership with Elon Musk’s Starlink to market broadband and internet satellite services in India. This will enhance Airtel’s existing network and expand coverage to remote areas, awaiting regulatory approval. This collaboration signifies Airtel’s commitment to providing reliable internet connectivity across the country.

title: Delimitation will punish states that controlled population: Congress
content: Congress has stated that states which controlled population will lose seats due to delimitation based on population criteria. States like Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh are expected to lose seats, while Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, and Rajasthan are among the gainers. Tamil Nadu's chief minister has invited various parties to join a joint action committee against this exercise.

title: 'Worth The Wait': T.J. and Dani Watt announce birth of first child, Blakely Marie
content: T.J. Watt  and his wife, Dani, announced the birth of their first child, Blakely Marie Watt, on Monday. The news was shared in a joint Instagram post on both parents' accounts, featuring six black-and-white photos of the baby girl. Watt's former  Pittsburgh Steelers  teammate  Russell Wilson  and  Las Vegas Raiders  defensive end  Maxx Crosby  were among those to offer well-wishes, as was Blakely Marie's uncle J.J. Watt. "Welcome to the world Blakely!!!!!" the older Watt commented. A post shared by Dani Watt (@danimariewatt) T.J. and Dani announced a child was on the way  in a post  last September. The pair were wed in September 2022.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Ankalaev is in, but what about Pereira?
content: ankalaev enters the top 10 for the first time on a pair of ballots . one voter has him in the top four, while another puts him near the bottom of the rankings . both light heavyweights -- former champ and current one -- are in the ESPN men's pound-for-pound top 10 .

title: Xabi Alonso's coaching career at a crossroads after UCL exit
content: Xabi Alonso has grown accustomed to being applauded by all sides of the bayArena . the bayer leverkusen coach was treated like a hero by the home supporters . he won the UEFA champions league last season without losing a single league game .

title: How Telugu Actress Soundarya Was Charred To Death In 2004 Plane Crash
content: soundarya had just joined the BJP in 2004 . she was on her way to Karimnagar in neighbouring Andhra Pradesh . five minutes later, the Cessna burst into a ball of flames and crashed .

title: Why newly acquired QB Justin Fields will play position like no other in Jets history
content: the pendulum often swings in the opposite direction because it overcompensates for its perceived shortcomings . the theory applies to the Jets and their quarterback situation . fields has averaged 50.2 rushing yards per game in four seasons .

title: Blades Found In Hostel Food At Hyderabad University, Students Stage Protest
content: Students found blades in the food served to them at a hostel mess in Hyderabad's Osmania University. This incident, reported at the university's Godavari hostel, caused widespread concern among students. Further, students sat on a protest alleging that previous complaints about insects and blades being found in the food have fallen on deaf ears. The students have demanded immediate action from the university authorities, including the Vice-Chancellor and Chief Warden. Students had staged a similar protest in front of the Ladies Hostel Complex in Amberpet last year due to the poor food quality served in the hostel. Reports had claimed worms were found in the meal, adding that at least 10 hostel students had fallen ill and were experiencing stomach problems. The protesters had said that the problem with the hostel's food was ongoing since November 2023. Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world
